Description: Tissue (mouse brain or blood) from which the sample comes
If the sample comes from an adult or a pup mouse
If the sample comes from a female (F) or male (M)  mouse
The experiment (nicotine or smoking exposure) to which the sample mouse was subjected; it could be an exposed or a control mouse of that experiment
If the sample belongs to a nicotine/smoking-exposed mouse (Expt) or a nicotine/smoking control mouse (Ctrl)
If the sample comes from a pregnant (Yes) or not pregnant (No) mouse
Is the plate (1,2 or 3) in which the sample library was prepared
Is the medium in which the sample was treated: water for brain samples and an elution buffer (EB) for the blood ones
Is the sequencing batch of each sampIe
Is the decimal fraction of reads that mapped to the mitochondrial chromosome of the total reads that mapped to the genome (mapping reads) in each sample
Fraction of the total mapping reads that mapped to ribosomal genes in each sample
Decimal fraction of reads that mapped to the reference genome in each sample
Proportion of the total reads of each sample that were assigned to genes
Summary statistic quantifying the difference of the expected and actual concentrations of control RNAs (from the External Control Consortium ERCC) in each sample
The total sum of read counts across all genes in each sample
Total number of genes whose expression was detected (non-zero expressed) in each sample

Variable name: Percentage of mitochondrial genes' read counts
Description: The percentage of the total sample counts that correspond to reads mapping to mitochondrial genes

Variable name: Percentage of ribosomal genes' read counts
Description: The percentage of the total sample counts that correspond to reads mapping to ribosomal genes
